title.narrative: ONL Support to OXFAM Rwanda Programme

description.narrative:
country programme support to sustainable livelihood, participatory governance and gender justice activities in Rwanda for the period ended 31st Dec 20: details are below The Oxfam Novib Board of Directors decision of October 2014 to withdraw from investment in the Rwanda country program resulted in a Phase-out/Hand-over schedule whereby a very limited number of partners received a supplementary contract on their existing contract to facilitate smooth phase out. As part of this Phase-out/Hand-over the basis was to ensure that all direct partner contracts would end by September 2015 thus leaving ample time for reporting and file closing by end 2015. Thesupport to the operations of the Country office was secured in the Operational budget and not part of the program budget. In order to give the new Rwanda Oxfam Country Strategy (2015-2020) a good start it was however decided to verify if the 3 program components of a) Sustainable Livelihoods (SLP), b) Participatory Governance (PGP) and c) Gender Justice (GJP), had funding gaps.
2 a transfer of Euro 128,000 for programme support to the Rwanda country programme project A-04581-02-506276 of Counterpart Oxfam (GB) in Rwanda All 3 program leads indicated clear funding gaps for their program during 2015 and requested for additional funding. These requests were analysed showing that we could support the total PGP gap, and the total SLP gap of the initial submission. A very late 2nd submission was made by SLP for 15,000 Euro for 'Improved Business Operations of MFIs and SACCOs with Pro-Poor Financial Products' as a redirection of earlier committed unrestricted funding from the executing affiliate towards management costs was made. This submissioncould not be supported. The direct GJP outcomes, not involving the Mass campaign as the latter would on its own already demand 88,000 Euro, could also be supported. All the different activities could contribute somehow to ONL outcomes and this will be captured inthe Inter affiliate MoU to be signed between ONL and OGB.
This means that the program support to the Rwanda Country programme willbe fot he following components and amounts; SLP 34,000 Pounds or 47,600 Euro PGP 29,900 Pounds or 37,700 Euro GJP 30,500 pounds or 42,700 Euro
Which totals to 128,000 Euro, which should be transferred to the Rwanda country programme with the clarity that this program support should all be spend by December 2015.
3 Recommendation Oxfam Novib to make available to OGB in Rwanda as executing affiliate, an amount of Euro 128,000 as soon as possible. This will be the last programme support of ONL towards the Rwnbada programme and all funds should be depleted by end 2015. Contractual implications relating to this program support will be laid down in an inter affiliate MoU

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood

description.narrative: no. of globally working partner organisations with enhanced lobby-, network- and research capacity for influencing international institutions and internationally operating companies with a pro-poor agenda

no. of globally working partner organisations with enhanced lobby-, network- and research capacity for influencing international institutions and internationally operating companies with a pro-poor agenda
